page.title: 04ENVIRONMENT AND ECOLOGY
page.content:
During the summer you can see a lot of swallows and house martins in the villages and hamlets in the area. There are a lot of streams and they support a lot of insect life which probably attracts them.
There are some interesting chalk hills around Okeford Fitzpaine, like Okeford Hill, which support special kinds of flowers and insect life. We have seen species of orchids up on the hill.
Occasionally, you may glimpse a deer in the area although they are very timid creatures and are rarely seen. However, they cause considerable damage to trees and crops.
